main_definition: To produce a document or image by transferring ink onto paper or another medium using printing technology.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Previously manufactured copies of books, newspapers, and other documents.
meanings_and_examples.example: I found an old printed version of my favorite novel at the local library.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process or result of producing text and images through a printing press or modern digital methods.
meanings_and_examples.example: She works in a print shop, where she operates various printing machines to produce flyers for her clients.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To have something officially published or recorded, usually referring to written work.
meanings_and_examples.example: The author's first book was printed by the publisher last month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression used metaphorically to describe a process that produces an outcome similar to printing text onto paper.
meanings_and_examples.example: The new marketing strategy will print their name across social media, reaching millions of potential customers.
